column1: Pinellas Park is a city located in central Pinellas County
column2: Florida
column3: United States. The population was 49
column4: 079 at the 2010 census. Originally home to northern transplants and vacationers
column5: the hundred year old city has grown into the fourth largest city in Pinellas County
column6: the most densely-populated county in Florida. The city and surrounding areas are almost completely urbanized. Pinellas Park contains a substantial portion of the Gateway area of the county
column9: and commercial development as it sits roughly in the middle of the Tampa Bay area's over two million people. Though technically land-locked
column10: its borders lie only a few miles from Tampa Bay to the east
column11: and Boca Ciega Bay and the Gulf of Mexico to the west. The city is known for its popular equestrian facilities and events
column12: and many residents also participate in fishing and water activities in nearby venues.

column1: The city was founded by Philadelphia publisher F. A. Davis
column2: who purchased 12
column3: 800 acres (52 km2) of Hamilton Disston's land around 1911. Promotional brochures lured northerners
column5: to the town
column6: noting the pleasant climate in the winter and the agreeable agricultural conditions. The Florida Association
column8: set up model farms and offered a free lot in the city with the purchase of ten acres of nearby farm land. The primary crop promoted was sugar cane. By 1912
column9: lots in the city were being sold separately. The City of Pinellas Park was formally incorporated on October 14
column10: 1914.Though not on the original Orange Line Railway
column11: Pinellas Park did have a train depot
column13: on the line between Clearwater and St. Petersburg. The city lay on the vehicle road from St. Petersburg to Tampa. Growth was moderate until after World War II
column14: when the city's population more than tripled.

column1: Pinellas Park is located at 27°51′08″N 82°42′26″W. Pinellas Park city limits are contiguous with those of St. Petersburg
column2: Clearwater
column3: Largo
column5: Kenneth City
column6: and unincorporated areas of Pinellas County. Annexation into the city is voluntary by both the property owner and the City Council.

column1: According to the United States Census Bureau
column2: the city has a total area of 16.2 square miles (41.9 km2)
column3: of which 15.5 square miles (40.2 km2) is land and 0.66 square miles (1.7 km2) (4.14%) is water.Because of the city's relatively low elevation between major bodies of water
column5: it has historically been subject to flooding. Through construction of a network of drainage canals and other measures by the Pinellas Park Water Management District
column6: flooding in the city has been greatly mitigated.

column1: Pinellas Park has a Council-Manager form of government. The current Mayor is Sandra Bradbury
column2: who is the daughter of former Mayor Cecil Bradbury. The current City Manager is Douglas Lewis. Various volunteer citizen boards are appointed by the City Council to advise the Council on normal governmental matters.

column1: The City maintains its own Police Department of more than 150 employees. Police Chief Mike Haworth in 2015 assumed the position previously held by Dorene Thomas
column2: the first female police chief in the county.The Fire Department was established in 1912
column3: when the City had only 50 residents. It serves the City and the surrounding areas.

column1: The Police Department facilitates the Police Explorers
column2: a youth education and service group. Likewise
column3: the Fire Department facilitates the Fire Explorers. Youth in both programs are involved in community service as well as competitions among similar groups.

column1: Pinellas Park is known throughout the Tampa Bay area for a series of community events held annually in a city-owned bandshell located behind City hall. The most popular of these events is "Country in the Park"
column2: a festival held every year generally on the third Saturday of March
column3: but always after the Florida State Fair and Florida Strawberry Festival. The festival's popularity stems from its wide array of events
column4: such as arts and crafts shows
column5: NASCAR displays
column6: popular amusement park rides
column10: and attendance of the concert are all free of charge. As of 2011
column11: the Country in the Park festival has been organized for 21 years straight.

column1: Another popular celebration among the locals is Pride in the Park. This celebration occurs during the week leading up to Country in the Park. Usually the night before Country in the Park
column2: the firefighters' chili cookoff takes place at the bandshell.

column1: Pinellas Park is home to a memorial to the Korean War
column2: located in Freedom Lake Park.

column1: Mrs. Madalya Fagan was the first president of the library association
column2: and through the efforts of this volunteer organization
column3: the Pinellas Park Public Library was established in December 1948. Fifteen years later
column4: the city of Pinellas Park took control over the library. Marjorie Trimble was the very first paid librarian
column5: although it wouldn't be until 1967 when Ms. Harrop would be the first librarian who possessed a Master of Library Science degree to be hired.

column1: The first library building was located in Park Station
column2: an old pump house in the middle of Triangle Park. The second library was then built at 5795 Park Boulevard
column3: although that structure no longer stands. The current library was built in 1969
column5: across the street from City Hall and Pinellas Park Elementary School. The library was last remodeled in 2001 and has underwent several additions that expanded the original 7
column6: 000 square feet interior into 30
column8: which includes over 26 adult desktop computers
column12: and two meeting rooms for rentals and programs.

column2: 2014 the library was renamed in honor of late director Barbara S. Ponce. Mrs. Ponce was promoted to community activities administrator and library director in 1999. The job placed her over the Pinellas Park Library

column1: The Pinellas Park Civic Orchestra and the Sunsation Show Chorus perform regularly in the City-owned 500-seat Performing Arts Center. Regular theatre organ concerts are given at the City Auditorium
column2: home to a "Mighty Wurlitzer" restored by the local chapter of the American Theatre Organ Society. The Pinellas Park Arts Society holds monthly themed contests in the Park Station building

column1: The Tampa Bay Automobile Museum displays an extensive collection of historical automobiles with an emphasis on progressive engineering achievement
column2: the personal interest of founder and benefactor Alain Cerf. The museum houses a unique working full-scale replica of the first self-propelled mechanical vehicle
column3: the fardier of Nicolas-Joseph Cugnot. Luxury cars currently displayed and sold in Pinellas Park include Rolls-Royce Motor Cars

column6: and Aston Martin. These and a  Maserati dealership are all located in the Gateway area near the Automobile Museum. The duPont Registry
